Building Ventilation and Filtration

UC Davis is taking steps to ensure campus ventilation and filtration systems provide appropriate COVID-19 risk mitigation. Learn more here.





Need a Key to Access Your Building?

Many buildings are returning to normal operating hours. If your building remains locked, click here for procedures to request a key. For questions related to Aggie Access please visit aggieaccess.ucdavis.edu.





Urgent Requests

Call: (530) 752-1655
Our Customer Experience Center is available 24/7.
Issues that impact human/animal health and safety, threaten research or affect instruction are considered urgent requests.





Non-urgent Requests

For non-urgent request, submit a work order online.
Non-urgent requests are non-threatening to life or research. Each non-urgent requests will be assigned as either elevated or routine priority.
Example:
Sticky doors
Key replacement
Building cosmetic touch-ups





 






 



How to submit a service request on AggieFacilities
Additional resources on our work order system










Facilities Management
We strive to make the university better every day through innovative stewardship of campus assets and resources. We aim to provide, maintain and improve the campus environment by working alongside campus partners to deliver exceptional customer service.




Facilities Management News






 




How FM Plans for the Future


by  Amy Burns


February 23, 2023



Deferred Maintenance
Facilities Services


Have you wondered how UC Davis buildings and infrastructure are managed in the face of growing populations, climate change, or general wear and tear over time? Our Asset Management team stays on top of these challenges through planning and the use of deferred maintenance (DM) funding so we can contribute to work, learn and enjoy our beautiful campus.





 




Student Spotlight: Reevan Cole


by  Amy Burns


February 23, 2023



Community Engagement
Sustainability Improvements


This month, we are getting to know Reevan Cole, one of the faces behind LEED-certifying buildings! As a Sustainable Environmental Design major, Reevan's studies align with her Facilities Management (FM) work. Before starting at FM in October of 2022, she spent the summer interning at a construction company which familiarized her with LEED since its presence is increasing in the industry. 





 




Employee Spotlight: Eric Kite


by  Amy Burns


February 23, 2023



Community Engagement
Facilities Services


With 25 years of trade experience, Eric Kite is well-versed as a Steam Mechanic at Building Maintenance Services (BMS). Before joining the Facilities Management (FM) team two years ago, Eric worked with UC Davis as a contractor. Upon meeting the folks at FM, he knew he wanted to work here!

Deferred Maintenance
Teams from FOA have completed or are actively working on $50M+ in deferred maintenance projects with more planned for the future. This website shares how, when and where we are tackling the campus's most critical needs.
